intro: Caulanthus annuus, commonly known as the annual California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers and slender, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Caulanthus annuus produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
